member.name: T:KeepCoding.Internal.RoutineBase
member.summary: Provides the base for the multiple routine types.
member.remarks: provides the general functionality that different types of routines share in common with. As each different type of routine gives different amounts of generics, this base is therefore non-generic and provides every method that doesn't require it. This can therefore be used as a way of passing in an ambiguous type of routine.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.Internal.RoutineBase.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Indexes into .
member.value: A coroutine from based on the index that was passed in.
member.remarks: Given that acts as a wrapper for handling mulitple coroutines, all of which stored in a , this acts as shorthand for accessing a specific index from .
member.param: The index to index into .
member.exception: The parameter is out of range from .
member.returns: The coroutine from .

member.name: P:KeepCoding.Internal.RoutineBase.IsRunning
member.summary: Determines whether it is currently running any coroutines.
member.value: A representing the state in which any coroutines are running.
member.remarks: Typically when coroutines are running they act as a black box with no way to access whether they have finished or not. This property allows you to determine if the containing variable is handling any coroutines. Multiple coroutines running at the same time will still return , and there is no way to determine the amount of coroutines running at once.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.Internal.RoutineBase.Count
member.summary: The amount of coroutines stored.
member.remarks: Given that acts as a wrapper for handling mulitple coroutines, all of which stored in a , this acts as shorthand for accessing the from . will never be which means never throws an exception. Note that this does not store the amount of coroutines running, as finished coroutines will still be kept inside the . When or is called however, the coroutines to get removed from the which will change the count and therefore this getter.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.Internal.RoutineBase.Coroutines
member.summary: The collection of all coroutines.
member.value: The which contains all of the stored coroutines.
member.remarks: can store multiple coroutines in order to be able to handle multiple coroutines. This starts out empty and will never be .

member.name: M:KeepCoding.Internal.RoutineBase.Stop
member.summary: Stops the first coroutine that was called, and removes it from .
member.remarks: Every time a coroutine gets added, it does so at the end of the . When is called, the first and therefore oldest coroutine gets removed from this list in a similar vein to . Note that when the coroutines are finished, they do not get removed from the list. If is called on a coroutine which has already stopped, the first coroutine will still be attempted to be stopped, which will in that case do nothing, and be removed from the list.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.Internal.RoutineBase.StopAll
member.summary: Stops all coroutines that were called, and makes empty.
member.remarks: stops and removes all coroutines from , as such, it cannot be called twice in a row without throwing an exception or adding a coroutine in-between. Note that when the coroutines are finished, they do not get removed from the list. If is called on coroutines which have already stopped, those coroutines will still be attempted to be stopped, which will in that case do nothing, and be removed from the list.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.Internal.RoutineBase.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Gets the of the from .
member.remarks: This retrieves the as an . Note that is never but is empty by default.
member.returns: as using .

member.name: T:KeepCoding.Internal.Tuple
member.summary: Provides the base for the multiple tuple types.
member.remarks: provides the general functionality that different types of tuples share in common with. As each different type of tuple gives different amounts of generics, this base is therefore non-generic and provides every method that doesn't require it. This can therefore be used as a way of passing in an ambiguous type of tuple.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.Internal.Tuple.Item(System.Byte)
member.summary: Passes an index into the tuple, where items are considered ordered and part of an array.
member.remarks: A will always throw an regardless if the getter or setter is called as it contains no items to index into. The purpose of this indexer is to provide all derived classes the same message. As there is type ambiguity between multiple generics, the type has to be as any value is passed into each item.
member.param: The index to pass into .
member.exception: The parameter is out of range because there are no items in this tuple type.
member.returns: , ignoring .

member.summary: Determines the amount of items in the tuple type.
member.value: The number of generics in the current type.
member.remarks: The length is the amount of items in the tuple, which can be used to index or the indexer .

member.name: P:KeepCoding.Internal.Tuple.UpperBound
member.summary: Determines the upperbound of the amount of the length.
member.remarks: This can be used for indexing or the indexer , getting the last item of the tuple. Calling assumes that there is at least 1 generic in this type.
member.exception: The length is 0, and therefore the upper bound doesn't exist.

member.summary: Compares itself and another to determine if they contain the same values.
member.remarks: The comparison is done by taking both of their values and comparing them with . Note that if the tuples are different sizes, this will automatically return . For more information, .

member.name: M:KeepCoding.Internal.Tuple.GetHashCode
member.summary: Gets the hash code of .
member.remarks: Hash codes are a way of quickly asserting equality. It converts all of the given relevant variables into hash codes and combines into a number that makes it unlikely for two different types to have the same hash code. That being said, it is still possible for the hash codes to be identical but not for the same values to have different hash codes, which is why it only should be used as the first step in determining equality and confirming by making the final comparisons to those with equal hash codes. For more information, see .
member.returns: The hash code of this instance.

member.summary: Joins to a string, with a space as a delimiter.
member.remarks: Each element of is passed into to unpack iterators and allow each element to be seen. For more details about stringification, refer to .

member.name: M:KeepCoding.ArrayHelper.BinarySearch(System.Array,System.Object)
member.summary: Searches an entire one-dimensional sorted array for a specific element, using the interface implemented by each element of the array and by the specified object.
member.param: The sorted one-dimensional Array to search.
The object to search for.
member.returns: The index of the specified in the specified , if is found; otherwise, a negative number. If is not found and is less than one or more elements in , the negative number returned is the bitwise complement of the index of the first element that is larger than . If is not found and is greater than all elements in , the negative number returned is the bitwise complement of (the index of the last element plus 1). If this method is called with a non-sorted , the return can be incorrect and a negative number could be returned, even if is present in .

member.summary: Assigns events specified into . Reassigning them will replace their values.

member.name: T:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.JsQuotes
member.summary: Selects how the escaped JS string should be put into quotes.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.JsQuotes.Single
member.summary: Put single quotes around the output. Single quotes are allowed in JavaScript only, but not in JSON.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.JsQuotes.Double
member.summary: Put double quotes around the output. Double quotes are allowed both in JavaScript and JSON.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.JsQuotes.None
member.summary: Do not put any quotes around the output. The escaped output may be surrounded with either type of quotes.

member.summary: Performs a binary search for the specified key on a . When no match exists, returns the nearest indices for interpolation/extrapolation purposes.
member.remarks: If an exact match exists, index1 == index2 == the index of the match. If an exact match is not found, index1 < index2. If the key is less than every key in the list, index1 is int.MinValue and index2 is 0. If it's greater than every key, index1 = last item index and index2 = int.MaxValue. Otherwise index1 and index2 are the indices of the items that would surround the key were it present in the list.
member.param: List to operate on.
The key to look for.
Receives the value of the first index (see remarks).
Receives the value of the second index (see remarks).

member.summary: Reverses the escaping done by . Note that unescaping is not fully C/C#-compatible in the sense that not all strings that are valid string literals in C/C# can be correctly unescaped by this procedure.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.Trim(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Returns the specified collection, but with leading and trailing empty strings and nulls removed.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.WordWrap(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Word-wraps the current string to a specified width. Supports UNIX-style newlines and indented paragraphs.

remarks.para: The supplied text will be split into "paragraphs" at the newline characters. Every paragraph will begin on a new line in the word-wrapped output, indented by the same number of spaces as in the input. All subsequent lines belonging to that paragraph will also be indented by the same amount.
All multiple contiguous spaces will be replaced with a single space (except for the indentation).

member.param: Text to be word-wrapped.
The maximum number of characters permitted on a single line, not counting the end-of-line terminator.
The number of spaces to add to each line except the first of each paragraph, thus creating a hanging indentation.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.UnifyLineEndings(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to detect Unix-style and Mac-style line endings and converts them to Windows (\r\n).

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.UrlStartsWith(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified URL starts with the specified URL path. For example, the URL "/directory/file" starts with "/directory" but not with "/dir".

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.SubstringSafe(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Same as but does not throw exceptions when the start index falls outside the boundaries of the string. Instead the result is truncated as appropriate.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.SubstringSafe(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Same as but does not throw exceptions when the start index or length (or both) fall outside the boundaries of the string. Instead the result is truncated as appropriate.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.EqualsNoCase(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether this string is equal to the other string under the ordinal case-insensitive comparison ().

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.ContainsNoCase(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether this string contains the other string under the ordinal case-insensitive comparison ().

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.EndsWith(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Char})
member.summary: Returns true if and only if this string ends with the specified character.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.StartsWith(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Char})
member.summary: Returns true if and only if this string starts with the specified character.ToDictionary

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.FromHex(System.String)
member.summary: Reconstructs a byte array from its hexadecimal representation (hexdump).

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.Unindent(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the overall indentation of the specified string while maintaining the relative indentation of each line.
member.param: String to remove indentation from.
member.returns: A string in which every line that isnt all whitespace has had spaces removed from the beginning equal to the least amount of spaces at the beginning of any line.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.Indent(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Inserts spaces at the beginning of every line contained within the specified string.
member.param: String to add indentation to.
Number of spaces to add.
If true (default), all lines are indented; otherwise, all lines except the first.
member.returns: The indented string.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.RemoveCommonIndentation(System.String)
member.summary: Removes spaces from the beginning of every line in such a way that the smallest indentation is reduced to zero. Lines which contain only whitespace are not considered in the calculation and may therefore become empty.
member.param: The string to transform.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.Split(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Splits a string into chunks of equal size. The last chunk may be smaller than , but all chunks, if any, will contain at least 1 character.
member.param: String to split into chunks.
Size of each chunk. Must be greater than zero.
member.returns: A lazy-evaluated collection containing the chunks from the string.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.Replace(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.StringComparison)
member.summary: Returns a new string in which all occurrences of in the current instance, identified using the specified string comparison, are replaced with .

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.Split(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Returns a string array that contains the substrings in this string that are delimited by elements of a specified string array.
member.param: String to be split.
Strings that delimit the substrings in this string.
member.returns: An array whose elements contain the substrings in this string that are delimited by one or more strings in separator. For more information, see the Remarks section.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.SplitNoEmpty(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Returns a string array that contains the substrings in this string that are delimited by elements of a specified string array. Empty items (zero-length strings) are filtered out.
member.param: String to be split.
Strings that delimit the substrings in this string.
member.returns: An array whose elements contain the substrings in this string that are delimited by one or more strings in separator. For more information, see the Remarks section.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.IsNumeric(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the string contains only the characters 0-9.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.AddLine(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds the specified line to the end of the current string. Returns the line if the current string is null.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.ReadLines(System.IO.TextReader)
member.summary: Enumerates all (remaining) lines from this text reader, reading lines only when needed, and hence compatible with potentially blocking or infinite streams.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.Path(System.Xml.Linq.XContainer)
member.summary: Returns the path to this element. The path consists of the names of all parents of this element up to the root node, separated with forward slashes.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.Path(System.Xml.Linq.XAttribute)
member.summary: Returns the path of this attribute. The path consists of the of this attribute's element, followed by attribute name in square brackets.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.ChkElement(System.Xml.Linq.XContainer,System.Xml.Linq.XName)
member.summary: Returns the first element matching "name", or if none, throws an exception to say which element was missing which sub-element. This is a counterpart to .

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.ChkAttribute(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,System.Xml.Linq.XName)
member.summary: Returns the first attribute matching "name", or if none, throws an exception to say which element was missing which attribute. This is a counterpart to .

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.AsDouble(System.Xml.Linq.XAttribute)
member.summary: Returns the value of this attribute, converted to a double. If the conversion cannot succeed, throws an exception describing which attribute was expected to be a double.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.ElementI(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the first (in document order) child element with the specified local name (ignoring the namespace).
member.param: XML element to search.
The name to match.
member.returns: The first element found or null if no such element exists.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.ElementsI(System.Xml.Linq.XContainer,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a filtered collection of the child elements of this element or document, in document order. Only elements that have the specified local name (ignoring the namespace) are included in the collection.
member.param: XML element to search.
The name to match.
member.returns: The first element found or null if no such element exists.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.AttributeI(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the first attribute of this element that has the specified local name (ignoring the namespace).
member.param: XML element to search.
The name to match.
member.returns: The first attribute if found or null if no such attribute exists.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.UtilityHelper.AttributesI(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a filtered collection of attributes of this element. Only elements that have the specified local name (ignoring the namespace) are included in the collection.
member.param: XML element to search.
The name to match.
member.returns: The filtered collection of attributes..

member.name: T:KeepCoding.ModConfig`1
member.summary: Meant for information that needs to be deserialized within the mod settings folder, by samfundev.
member.typeparam: The type to serialize and deserialize the file.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.ModConfig`1.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new with the target file name and an optional event of when the file is read. A file will automatically be made if it doesn't exist. A JSON property defined in the type that isn't in the file will automatically write to the file with said property.
member.remarks: In the editor, the constructor will not merge the default values of the type with the file.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.ModConfig`1.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new with the target file name and an optional event of when the file is read. A file will automatically be made if it doesn't exist. A JSON property defined in the type that isn't in the file will automatically write to the file with said property.
member.remarks: In the editor, the constructor will not merge the default values of the type with the file.
member.param: The file name to get.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.ModConfig`1.HasReadSucceeded
member.summary: Whether or not there has been a successful read of the settings file. This value will always be false in the editor.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.ModConfig`1.Log``1(``0,UnityEngine.LogType)
member.summary: Logs message, but formats it to be compliant with the Logfile Analyzer.
member.param: The message to log.
The type of logging. Different logging types have different icons within the editor.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.ModConfig`1.Log``1(``0,System.Object[])
member.summary: Logs multiple entries, but formats it to be compliant with the Logfile Analyzer.
member.param: The message to log.
All of the arguments to embed into .

member.name: M:KeepCoding.ModConfig`1.LogMultiple(System.String[])
member.summary: Logs multiple entries to the console.
member.param: The array of logs to individual output into the console.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.ModConfig`1.Merge(`0,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reads, merges, and writes the settings to the settings file. To protect the user settings, this does nothing if the read isn't successful.
member.remarks: In the editor, this method does nothing.
member.param: The value to merge the file with.
Determines whether it should remove values from the original file that isn't contained within the type, or has the incorrect type.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.ModConfig`1.Write(`0)
member.summary: Writes the settings to the settings file. To protect the user settings, this does nothing if the last read wasn't successful.
member.remarks: In the editor, this method does nothing.
member.param: The value to overwrite the settings file with.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.ModConfig`1.Write(System.String)
member.summary: Writes the string to the settings file. To protect the user settings, this does nothing if the last read wasn't successful.
member.remarks: In the editor, this method does nothing.
member.param: The contents to write.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.ModConfig`1.SerializeSettings(`0)
member.summary: Serializes settings the same way it's written to the file. Supports settings that use enums.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.ModConfig`1.ToString
member.summary: Deserializes, then reserializes the file according to .
member.remarks: In the editor, this method serializes the default value of the constructor in .
member.returns: A string representation of the value from .

member.name: M:KeepCoding.ModConfig`1.Read
member.summary: Reads the settings from the settings file. If the settings couldn't be read, the default settings will be returned.
member.remarks: In the editor, this method returns the default value of the constructor in .

member.name: T:KeepCoding.MonoRandom
member.summary: A pseudo-random number generator that is primarily used to get multiple platforms to share the same random number generator.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, using a time-dependent default seed value.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.MonoRandom.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, using the specified seed value.
member.param: A number used to calculate a starting value for the pseudo-random number sequence. If a negative number is specified, the absolute value of the number is used.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.MonoRandom.Seed
member.summary: The seed used for the randomization.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.MonoRandom.NextBytes(System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Fills the elements of a specified array of bytes with random numbers.
member.param: An array of bytes to contain random numbers.
Determines whether it should log the result.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.MonoRandom.Log``1(``0,UnityEngine.LogType)
member.summary: Logs message, but formats it to be compliant with the Logfile Analyzer.
member.param: The message to log.
The type of logging. Different logging types have different icons within the editor.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.MonoRandom.Log``1(``0,System.Object[])
member.summary: Logs multiple entries, but formats it to be compliant with the Logfile Analyzer.
member.param: The message to log.
All of the arguments to embed into .

member.name: M:KeepCoding.MonoRandom.LogMultiple(System.String[])
member.summary: Logs multiple entries to the console.
member.param: The array of logs to individual output into the console.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.MonoRandom.Next(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a nonnegative random number.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer greater than or equal to zero and less than .
member.param: Determines whether it should log the result.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.MonoRandom.Next(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a nonnegative random number less than the specified maximum.
member.param: The exclusive upper bound of the random number to be generated. must be greater than or equal to zero.
Determines whether it should log the result.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer greater than or equal to zero, and less than ; that is, the range of return values ordinarily includes zero but not . However, if equals zero, is returned.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.MonoRandom.Next(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a random number within a specified range.
member.param: The inclusive lower bound of the random number returned.
The exclusive upper bound of the random number returned. must be greater than or equal to .
Determines whether it should log the result.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer greater than or equal to and less than ; that is, the range of return values includes but not . If equals , is returned.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.MonoRandom.NextDouble(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a random number between 0.0 and 1.0.
member.param: Determines whether it should log the result.
member.returns: A double-precision floating point number greater than or equal to 0.0, and less than 1.0.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.MonoRandom.Sample(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a random number between 0.0 and 1.0.
member.param: Determines whether it should log the result.
member.returns: A double-precision floating point number greater than or equal to 0.0, and less than 1.0.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.MonoRandom.Shuffle``1(``0,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Shuffles a list using an in-place algorithm; the original list is modified.
member.typeparam: The type of list to shuffle.
member.param: The list to shuffle.
Determines whether it should log the result.
member.returns: shuffled using Fisher-Yates shuffle.

member.name: T:KeepCoding.ITP
member.summary: Interface for Twitch Plays support.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.ITP.IsCancelCommand
member.summary: Determines if it should cancel command processing. If this returns true, then stop processing the command, clean up, then do a yield return Cancelled; to acknowledge the cancel.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.ITP.IsTime
member.summary: Determines if it is in Time Mode, where solves change the timer. This is useful for modules that use the timer's value.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.ITP.IsTimeSkippable
member.summary: Determines if it should allow for the timer to be skipped when the module it is in, as well as any other modules that would like to skip time, are the only unsolved modules left on the bomb.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.ITP.IsTP
member.summary: Determines if Twitch Plays is currently active. This is for modules that need to display different items, or use different rules if Twitch Plays is active.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.ITP.IsZen
member.summary: Determines if the timer is counting up instead of down, for special cases, such as controlling how to sort button release times, or whether there is a low timer event or not.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.ITP.Help
member.summary: The help message that gets sent when typing !{id} help.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.ITP.Manual
member.summary: Specifies the manual that is looked up on The Manual Repository when !{id} manual is entered into chat.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.ITP.Abandons
member.summary: Declaring this field allows for Twitch Plays to inform the module that the bomb is in Time Mode, where solves change the timer. This is useful for modules that use the timer's value.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.ITP.ForceSolve
member.summary: When the module runs into an exception or the module is forced to be solved, it calls this method.
member.remarks: Make sure that the module is solved before this method closes, otherwise it causes a forced-solve.
member.returns: A series of instructions for the Twitch Plays mod to handle in order to guarantee a solve.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.ITP.Process(System.String)
member.summary: When a command is typed into Twitch Plays with the Id of this module, it calls this method and passes in the exact command typed.
member.remarks: Anything that gets yield returned will be processed by Twitch Plays. This includes other methods, , an of , , true, or null.
member.param: The user's command.
member.returns: A series of instructions for the Twitch Plays mod to handle as requested by the user.

member.name: T:KeepCoding.IAwake
member.summary: is called when the script instance is being loaded.
member.remarks: is used to initialize any variables or game state before the game starts. is called only once during the lifetime of the script instance. is called after all objects are initialized so you can safely speak to other objects or query them using for example . Each GameObject's is called in a random order between objects. Because of this, you should use to set up references between scripts, and use to pass any information back and forth. is always called before any functions. This allows you to order initialization of scripts. can not act as a coroutine. Note: Use instead of the constructor for initialization, as the serialized state of the is undefined at construction time. is called once, just like the constructor.

member.name: T:KeepCoding.IFixedUpdate
member.summary: Frame-rate independent message for physics calculations.
member.remarks: has the frequency of the physics system; it is called every fixed frame-rate frame. Compute system calculations after . 0.02 seconds (50 calls per second) is the default time between calls. Use to access this value. Alter it by setting it to your preferred value within a script, or, navigate to Edit > Settings > Time > Fixed Timestep and set it there. The frequency is more or less than . If the application runs at 25 frames per second (fps), Unity calls it approximately twice per frame, Alternatively, 100 fps causes approximately two rendering frames with one . Control the required frame rate and Fixed Timestep rate from Time settings. Use to set the frame rate. Use when using . Set a force to a and it applies each fixed frame. occurs at a measured time step that typically does not coincide with . In order to get the elapsed time since last call to , use . This function is only called if the is enabled. Override this function in order to provide your 's functionality.

member.name: T:KeepCoding.IStart
member.summary: is called on the frame when a script is enabled just before any of the methods is called the first time.
member.remarks: Like the function, is called exactly once in the lifetime of the script. However, is called when the script object is initialised, regardless of whether or not the script is enabled. may not be called on the same frame as if the script is not enabled at initialisation time. The function is called on all objects in the scene before any object's function is called. This fact is useful in cases where object A's initialisation code needs to rely on object B's already being initialised; B's initialisation should be done in while A's should be done in . Where objects are instantiated during gameplay, their function will naturally be called after the functions of scene objects have already completed.

member.name: T:KeepCoding.TPScript`1
member.summary: Base class for TwitchPlays support for solvable and needy modded modules in Keep Talking and Nobody Explodes.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.IsCancelCommand
member.summary: Determines if it should cancel command processing. If this returns , then stop processing the command, clean up, then do a ; to acknowledge the cancel.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.IsTime
member.summary: Determines if it is in Time Mode, where solves change the timer. This is useful for modules that use the timer's value.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.IsTimeSkippable
member.summary: Determines if it should allow for the timer to be skipped when the module it is in, as well as any other modules that would like to skip time, are the only unsolved modules left on the bomb.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.IsTP
member.summary: Determines if Twitch Plays is currently active. This is for modules that need to display different items, or use different rules if Twitch Plays is active.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.IsZen
member.summary: Determines if the timer is counting up instead of down, for special cases, such as controlling how to sort button release times, or whether there is a low timer event or not.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.Help
member.summary: The help message that gets sent when typing !{id} help.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.Manual
member.summary: Specifies the manual that is looked up on The Manual Repository when !{id} manual is entered into chat.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.Abandons
member.summary: This list contains modules that it should stop processing. Currently, the only module that uses this capability is Souvenir.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.Module
member.summary: The instance of the module.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.AutoSolve
member.summary: Yield return this to indicate automatically solving the module, as if it threw an exception while solving.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.CancelDetonate
member.summary: Yield return this to indicate cancelling a previously issued delayed detonation command on the same module.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.Cancelled
member.summary: Yield return this to indicate that you have stopped processing the command in response to the bool being set to .

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.EndMultipleStrikes
member.summary: Yield return this to indicate that the strike tracker should be enabled. If any strikes were issued during the time it was disabled, they will be awarded and the routine stopped at that point, otherwise, it will just cancel the "VoteNay Module {id} got 0 strikes! +0 strike to {Nickname}" message that would otherwise be posted. Likewise, if the module was solved at the time this command is issued, the processing will be stopped as of that point as well.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.EndWaitingMusic
member.summary: Yield return this to indicate stopping the waiting music mid-command.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.HideCamera
member.summary: Yield return this to hide the heads-up display and cameras while doing quaternion rotations, if it is expected that the camera/hud will get in the way.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.MultipleStrikes
member.summary: Yield return this to indicate that the issued command is going to cause more than one strike, so should disable the internal strike tracker in order to avoid flooding the chat with "VoteNay Module {id} got a strike! +1 strike to {Nickname}" for as many strikes as will be awarded. This also disables the internal solve tracker as well. This allows for sending additional messages or continue processing commands regardless of the solve/strike state.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.Solve
member.summary: Yield return this to indicate that this command will solve the module at some later point; all this does is tell Twitch Plays to attribute the solve to the author of this command.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.Strike
member.summary: Yield return this to indicate that this command will cause a strike at some later point; all this does is tell Twitch Plays to attribute the strike to the author of this command.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.ToggleWaitingMusic
member.summary: Yield return this to toggle the waiting music on and off mid-command.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.TryCancelSequence
member.summary: Yield return this to indicate that the KMSelectable[] sequence that follows this command should be cancelled if a "!cancel" or "!stop" is issued mid-way through that sequence.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.UnsubmittablePenalty
member.summary: Yield return this to indicate that the command couldn't submit an answer and should only be used to prevent users from guessing the answer. This should not be used if an answer could never be submittable for a module.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.WaitingMusic
member.summary: Yield return this to indicate playing the waiting music if a command will take long to finish.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.ForceSolve
member.summary: When the module runs into an exception or the module is forced to be solved, it calls this method.
member.remarks: Make sure that the module is solved before this method closes, otherwise it causes a forced-solve.
member.returns: A series of instructions for the Twitch Plays mod to handle in order to guarantee a solve.

member.remarks: Anything that gets yield returned will be processed by Twitch Plays. This includes other methods, , an of , , , or .
member.param: The user's command.
member.returns: A series of instructions for the Twitch Plays mod to handle as requested by the user.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.Detonate(System.Nullable{System.Single},System.String)
member.summary: Yield return this to explode the bomb instantly. is specified in number of seconds before the bomb explodes. (Note, sending another detonate command will auto-cancel the previous one on the same module if it hasn't happened already.). is the message to send to chat upon detonation. Both of the parameters are optional.
member.param: The amount of time before the bomb blows up.
The message to send.
member.returns: A formatted string for Twitch Plays.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.SkipTime(System.String)
member.summary: Yield return this to try advancing the clock to the specified time. You must put the full time you wish to skip to, and this time either needs to be less than the current time, if in normal/time mode, or greater than the current time, if in zen mode. Example, if you wanted to set the clock to 5:24, then you do "skiptime 324" or "skiptime 5:24". You can target partway through the seconds, such as "skiptime 45.28", which would then set the clock to 45.28, provided that time has NOT gone by already. You must also set to , for this function to work.
member.param: The time to skip to in seconds.
member.returns: A formatted string for Twitch Plays.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.AwardPoints(System.Int32)
member.summary: Yield return this to award the user that sent the command points directly, this is currently used for mods like Souvenir to give points to users that answered the questions equally.
member.param: The amount of points to award. Negatives supported.
member.returns: A formatted string for Twitch Plays.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.AwardPointsOnSolve(System.Int32)
member.summary: Yield return this to award the last user that sent the command points when the module is solved. The module must prevent any user from sending commands afterward in order for Twitch Plays to award points to the correct user. This is currently used by the Twin module when extra points must be given but the module is not solved immediately.
member.param: The amount of points to award. Negatives supported.
member.returns: A formatted string for Twitch Plays.

member.name: T:KeepCoding.HashCode
member.summary: Combines the hash code for multiple values into a single hash code. xxHash32 is used for the hash code.
member.remarks: You can use HashCode to combine multiple values (for example, fields on a structure or class) into a single hash code. This structure operates in one of two ways, static methods that accept a set of up to eight values to combine, and two instance methods that operate in a streaming fashion, accepting values one at a time.

member.summary: Adds a single value to the hash code.
member.typeparam: The type of the value to add to the hash code.
member.param: The value to add to the hash code.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.HashCode.Add``1(``0,System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer{``0})
member.summary: Adds a single value to the hash code, specifying the type that provides the hash code function.
member.typeparam: The type of the value to add to the hash code.
member.param: The value to add to the hash code.
The to use to calculate the hash code. This value can be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), which will use the default equality comparer for .

member.name: M:KeepCoding.HashCode.Combine``1(``0)
member.summary: Diffuses the hash code returned by the specified value.
member.remarks: Some data structures assume that hash codes are diffused across a large range. This method improves the quality of the hash code returned by the value and is useful when the underlying data type is simple, for example, an integer value.
member.typeparam: The type of the value to add the hash code.
member.param: The value to add to the hash code.
member.returns: The hash code that represents the single value.
